title: Poison clarity
body:
So a good while back, a short while after Cassiopeia had been updated I had talked about things that I felt were important QoL changes to Cass and poison users as a whole.

One of the main ones I had discussed was poison clarity. Here is my exact Quote:
>ONE THING I THINK NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED. This is very serious and I think you really need to look into it Stashu, I'll make an entire thread on it if I have to. Is the clarity of targets that are poisoned. In big teamfights I feel it needs to be necessary that targets that Cass has poisoned are actually poisoned. Like some times I'm finding myself mashing Q and trying to spam E and sometimes I can't tell if my Q actually landed or if I'm about to hit a target with twin fang and put my E on cooldown.

I was responded to by a Rioter, **Riot Stashu**, and here was his response:
>There's actually a thread on this (well, poison indicators in general) right now that's gaining some traction, and it's something that we'd definitely like to do. Totally agree that it would go a long way, the current particles are just not up to par with the clarity bar we've established over the past few years.

I went looking for the thread he mentioned and never ended up finding it. It wasn't a top priority for me at the time so I sort of brushed it under the rug since it wasn't that big a deal.

Fast forward to today and poison clarity has still not been updated. So I'm posting this thread to try and resolve that and offer what I feel would be a reasonable solution WITH PICTURES! :D

Here is the current poison indicator:
https://i.imgur.com/ImopLoP.png
It's very subtle and hard to spot in big teamfights.

Now my personal proposition is that poisoned targets are fully highlighted purple when poisoned. I got the idea from the animation for the move "Toxic" on Pokemon Stadium shown here:
https://i.imgur.com/WyrscB7.png
This would add a lot of clarity to poison and I think it would be healthy for poison based champions as well as their opponents.

Thank you for taking the time to read through and I hope we can find a way to resolve this.

**Original Source Material:**
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/2YmVu2JW-cassiopeia-421-opinions

EDIT: I was hoping we could get a Rioter's opinion on this as well if possible.

replies.body: No, because if there would be multiple champions poisoned in one teamfight it would REALLY hurt clarity instead of helping it.

> [{quoted}](name=dont stop Niisan,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Q3QMcIQO,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-11-18T08:45:36.352+0000)
>
> No, because if there would be multiple champions poisoned in one teamfight it would REALLY hurt clarity instead of helping it.

I definitely believe your point has some weight to it, but I also believe that there has to be some kind of middle ground to all of this. Maybe a solution not quite as ridged as what I was suggesting, but again something that does help with the lack of clarity of targets who are poisoned because as of right now I still feel like there is definitely an issue as it currently stands.
What if the entire health bar was outlined in purple
Just have an effect like Sunfire Cape's orange ring, except purple, around poisoned targets. Or just make the current indicator larger and brighter in color.

I think they should probably only turn purple for the player that is Cassiopeia since it's only for her really important. I don't think it's important enough for other players to have such drastic effect.
I'm not sure if it's worth it, because I assume that veteran Cassio players already got used to the current visuals. It would make her slightly easier to pick up for other players, though. (Would be great for me when I get her in ARAM)

> [{quoted}](name=Dr Poro,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Q3QMcIQO,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-11-18T16:18:47.481+0000)
>
> I think they should probably only turn purple for the player that is Cassiopeia since it's only for her really important. I don't think it's important enough for other players to have such drastic effect.
> I'm not sure if it's worth it, because I assume that veteran Cassio players already got used to the current visuals. It would make her slightly easier to pick up for other players, though. (Would be great for me when I get her in ARAM)

That's part of the reason why I think this change is a good idea. It would allow players who are just trying Cass for the first time a bit of a cushion and it might help lessen the learning curve a bit. I mean she's definitely difficult enough as is, some QoL changes might do her some good.

I agree. I'd definitely like it. I'm just not sure if Riot thinks it's worth the effort. If it only has a purple recolor for Cassio, I don't think it's too much clutter. 

However, we have to be careful with recoloring a full champion because there'll be conflicting situations like Olaf ult + poisoned: which color takes priority?

I think just adding a purple tint to the poisoned champion (sorta like in the pokemon stadium screenshot, but more pronounced) would work just nicely. Perhaps a little skull icon somewhere would also be nice.
For now I would just recommend grabbing rylias. Think of it as a small bonus effect of visual notifications unique to poison champs. Big teamfights shouldn't happen often before then.
Rather than changing champion colors, you could add a dotted line towards poisoned champions like Yasuo's ult.
I wish the toxin duration would be clearer.  I've actually died to this once.

Making entire champion purple against champions who can poison for long period of times kills both point of skins/chromas (not going to enjoy it If you're permanently purple) and clarity, since while you will know who's poisoned, it may be hard for others to recognize who is who.

But gameplay over aesthetics and recognition is individual problem mostly (If the purple hue won't be significant, since the sillhuets are usually different, this shouldn't be that much of a problem), so If this would help majority and majority wouldn't have problem with it, I don't have one either.

> [{quoted}](name=Velzard of Koz,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Q3QMcIQO,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-11-18T15:37:44.955+0000)
>
> Making entire champion purple against champions who can poison for long period of times kills both point of skins/chromas (not going to enjoy it If you're permanently purple) and clarity, since while you will know who's poisoned, it may be hard for others to recognize who is who.
> 
> But gameplay over aesthetics and recognition is individual problem mostly (If the purple hue won't be significant, since the sillhuets are usually different, this shouldn't be that much of a problem), so If this would help majority and majority wouldn't have problem with it, I don't have one either.

Well I can definitely attest to the fact that it is definitely a case by case basis. I myself have issues tracking targets in teamfights and it's even worse when I try to look for specific particles. Then when you add something like graves ult and twitch poison it makes it basically impossible for me to see the tiny poison particles at times. I also agree though that this change should take into account the aesthetic qualities of opponents champions. I mean you pay good money for a skin, you don't wanna sit there purple all game and not enjoy it, you have to admit though it would make people try to avoid getting poisoned to avoid the dreaded purple tint. xD
